steps.description: Clean the area around the damage using a soft cloth, mild soap, and water. Make sure the area is free from dust and grime before starting the repair.
Use the sandpaper to gently smooth out the scratched area. Make sure to sand along the grain of the wood to avoid causing additional scratches.
Apply the wood filler to the scratch using the paintbrush. Make sure to spread it evenly over the scratch, filling it completely.
Let the wood filler dry according to the instructions on the package.
Once the wood filler is dry, sand it down until it is flush with the rest of the chair leg. Be careful not to sand too much, as this could cause more damage.
Paint or stain over the repaired area to match the rest of the chair. Apply as many coats as necessary, allowing each coat to dry before applying the next.

tips: Always sand in the direction of the wood grain
Use a fine-grit sandpaper for the final sanding before painting or staining
Make sure the paint or stain is thoroughly mixed before applying
